reviews.title: Mediocre, vulgar and miserly.
reviews.text: After spending a wonderful week in a great hotel in the area of Agios Nikolaos (Iberostar Mirabello), we spent a terrible extra night in Crete in this place due to the delay of our flight.

The hotel is located in the very centre of Irakleio, which is not exactly Paris. Our room was small and dull, with the carpet full of stains. We found hair on the pillows (some others of our group found clothes in the closet). It was terribly hot inside, but you couldn’t open the window (looking a narrow patio with all the air conditioned machines) because it was even hotter. You couldn’t turn the air conditioned on, either, because was too noisy for sleeping.
reviews.title: Average hotel, good value

reviews.text: On the morning, we kindly requested a document, in order to make a complaint before the company. It was impossible to obtain a single paper from the hotel, despite the fact that it was true that we spent one night there.

reviews.title: Good hotel
reviews.text: The hotel was centrally located with modern bathrooms, but our toilet seat was broken. The service was mediocre and the hotel was average, but the price was very good for the area.

reviews.title: Highly recommended 3 star
reviews.text: This is by far the most luxurious 3 star hotel I've ever stayed in -- marble and brass everywhere and it seemed to have been recently remodeled. It really seemed more like a 4 star hotel. I think it is in an excellent location in the center of Heraklion, only 1 block from the outdoor market and it's easy walking to the pedestrian mall, shopping, the two main squares, and the archaelogical museum. Parking is the only downside. There's cheap parking available about 4 blocks away.

reviews.title: Noisy
reviews.text: We stayed at the Olympic hotel for 1 night last year. The hotel is fine, but the location makes it very noisy. There was traffic noise until past midnight, which started up again at about 4 am.
